process.name: Process Template 1 - Basic
process.narrative: A basic Process Template: Best Practice Exception Handling Run once process (no polling) Process broken down into Work Step sub pages

stage.name: Mark Item As Completed
stage.narrative: Marks the current work queue item as complete

stage.name: Mark Item As Exception
stage.narrative: Marks the current work queue item as an exception

decision.expression: Lower([Exception Type])="system exception" OR Lower([Exception Type])="internal"

exception.detail: [Consecutive Exception Limit] & " consecutive incidents of " & [Exception Type] & ": " & [Exception Detail]

stage.name: Stop the process because consecutive exceptions are occuring
stage.narrative: The consecutive exception limit has been reached, so throw a new exception to terminate the process.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Status
input.narrative: The new status - 255 characters maximum.

stage.name: Start Up
stage.narrative: Prepares any variables according to the Run Mode, starts the applications and fills the queue.

stage.name: Close Down
stage.narrative: Closes down the applications and maintains the work queue.

stage.name: Reset Global Data
stage.narrative: This page is only used to reset global data items

decision.expression: IsStopRequested() OR [Stop After Items]=0 OR LocalTime()>[Stop After Time]

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the queue item to add the tag to

input.name: Tag
input.narrative: The tag to add to the item. Note that this cannot start with a '+' (plus) or '-' (minus) character, and cannot contain ';' (semi-colon) characters

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Add more steps as required

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. The tag should be in the format : ."+wanted tag; -unwanted tag ; other wanted tag".

output.name: Item ID
output.narrative: The ID of the item retrieved - empty if there are none available.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. The tag should be in the format : ."+wanted tag; -unwanted tag ; other wanted tag".

output.name: Item ID
output.narrative: The ID of the item retrieved - empty if there are none available.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

stage.name: Note9
stage.narrative: No more items available

stage.name: Stop After Time
stage.narrative: Used by the process to decide whether to keep working or close itself down. This value can be modified from Control Room to bring a session to an early finish.

stage.name: Stop After Items
stage.narrative: Used by the process to decide whether to keep working or close itself down. This value can be modified from Control Room to bring a session to an early finish.

stage.name: Note5
stage.narrative: This exception is different from the previous one.

stage.name: Note5
stage.narrative: This exception is the same as the previous one but the consecutive exception limit has not yet been reached.

stage.name: Note5
stage.narrative: Don't retry this type of exception, just mark the queue item and carry on.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Exception Reason
input.narrative: A description of the reason for the exception

input.name: Retry
input.narrative: Whether or not to retry the item, up to the maximum number of attempts specified for the queue. Optional - if not specified, the item will be retried

input.name: Keep Locked
input.narrative: Whether or not the clone of the item should remain locked after the exception has been registered and the item is retried. Optional - default is False

output.name: New Item ID
output.narrative: The Item ID of the newly cloned item. This item will be locked if 'Keep Locked' is True. This will be empty if no item was cloned (ie. the item was not retried.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Exception Reason
input.narrative: A description of the reason for the exception

input.name: Retry
input.narrative: Whether or not to retry the item, up to the maximum number of attempts specified for the queue. Optional - if not specified, the item will be retried

input.name: Keep Locked
input.narrative: Whether or not the clone of the item should remain locked after the exception has been registered and the item is retried. Optional - default is False

output.name: New Item ID
output.narrative: The Item ID of the newly cloned item. This item will be locked if 'Keep Locked' is True. This will be empty if no item was cloned (ie. the item was not retried.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the queue item to add the tag to

input.name: Tag
input.narrative: The tag to add to the item. Note that this cannot start with a '+' (plus) or '-' (minus) character, and cannot contain ';' (semi-colon) characters

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Can't log out so just terminate

decision.expression: [Retry Count]<[Retry Limit] AND (Lower(ExceptionType())="system exception" OR Lower(ExceptionType())="internal")

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1a

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1b

decision.expression: Lower([Exception Type])="system unavailable exception" OR Lower([Exception Type])="login system exception"

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to defer

input.name: Until
input.narrative: When to resume processing the case

exception.detail: [Consecutive Exception Limit] & " consecutive incidents of " & [Exception Type] & ": " & [Exception Detail]

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Navigate back ready for step 1a - maybe restart application (Close and Start pages)

decision.expression: [Retry Count]<[Retry Limit] AND (Lower(ExceptionType())="system exception" OR Lower(ExceptionType())="internal")

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1a

decision.expression: [Retry Count]<[Retry Limit] AND (Lower(ExceptionType())="system exception" OR Lower(ExceptionType())="internal")

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1b

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1c

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1d

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1e

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Navigate back ready for step 1a - maybe restart application (Close and Start pages)

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Navigate back ready for step 1c - maybe restart application (Close and Start pages), maybe additional navigation required

decision.expression: [Retry Count]<[Retry Limit] AND (Lower(ExceptionType())="system exception" OR Lower(ExceptionType())="internal")

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1a

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1b

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Navigate back ready for step 1a - maybe restart application (Close and Start pages)

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: System not working or can not log in

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Check for concurrent exceptions, a system change may have occured

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Tag exception category for Blue Prism Performance reports

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1- Launch

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 2 - Log in

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 1 - Log Out

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Step 2 - Terminate

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: This action should throw a Login System Exception if it thinks the credentials entered were incorrect

decision.expression: [Retry Count]<[Retry Limit] AND (Lower(ExceptionType())="system exception" OR Lower(ExceptionType())="internal")

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Navigate back ready for step 1d - maybe restart application (Close and Start pages), maybe additional navigation required

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Login System Exceptions will not be retried

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Enterprise License holders should always use Blue Prism Credentials Here

input.name: Credentials Name
input.narrative: The name of set of credentials to get

stage.name: Note1
stage.narrative: Logic Here to populate your queue from input source: Worklist system Excel or CSV Files Email Database Table Other

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the required lock. Mandatory parameter.

input.name: Timeout
input.narrative: The maximum amount of time to await the lock. Default is to wait forever

input.name: Preferred Token
input.narrative: The preferred token to use for the lock. Default behaviour is to generate a new unique token.

input.name: Comment
input.narrative: The comments to set on the lock

output.name: Token
output.narrative: The token registered against the lock. This will be empty if the lock could not be acquired

stage.name: Note6
stage.narrative: Another session is loading work

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the specific lock to be released. Default behaviour is to release all locks with the given token.

input.name: Token
input.narrative: The token associated with the lock(s) to be released. Mandatory parameter.

input.name: Comment
input.narrative: The comments to set on the lock(s)

input.name: All Sessions
input.narrative: True to release locks matching the specified constraints across all sessions; False to only release locks acquired in the current session. Default is False

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the specific lock to be released. Default behaviour is to release all locks with the given token.

input.name: Token
input.narrative: The token associated with the lock(s) to be released. Mandatory parameter.

input.name: Comment
input.narrative: The comments to set on the lock(s)

input.name: All Sessions
input.narrative: True to release locks matching the specified constraints across all sessions; False to only release locks acquired in the current session. Default is False

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Basic Populate Queue logic. See Template 2 for other examples

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Go to Process Examples - Adding work to a queue for ideas of how this might be done

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: You will need to clean up the application and navigate ready to perform the first action again

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: You can take the opportunity when traversing this page to confirm that the target applications are on the correct screen ready for processing the next case.

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: The case will only retry if the WQ has been configured to enable retries.
